hanzi-su-wiki:
湯

Значения

Кипяток, баня, ванна

Мнемоника

Вода 氵, нагретая косыми лучами 勿 солнца 日 — кипяток.

Варианты

汤
purpleculture_pinyin:
tāng
soup; hot or boiling water; decoction of medicinal herbs; water in which sth has been boiled
суп; горячая или кипящая вода; отвар лечебных трав; вода, в которой кипятилась
rtega_mnemonic:
湯湯RS
X		hot water
  • boiling liquid 氵 leaving the limits 昜 of a kettle
水; 沸

湯湯RS
汤汤		漡燙hot water, soup, gravy, broth

水; 沸
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 汤)
Pictophonetic: 昜 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
湯圓 [ tāng yuán ]: boiled balls of glutinous rice flour, eaten during the Lantern Festival
湯藥 [ tāng yào ]: tisane; decoction (Chinese medicine)
湯匙 [ tāng chí ]: soup spoon; tablespoon; Classifiers: 把
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 昜 [ yáng ] bright, glorious; to expand, to open up
heisig_chinese_memo: Imagine a hot water kettle for your instant miso soup, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot like the sun). Make sure to use a potholder!
heisig_constituent: hot water, water, water droplets, water pistol, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets
koohiiStory1: Imagine a hot water kettle for your tea, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot). Make sure to use a potholder!
koohiiStory2: Hot water is a phrase that can mean "getting into trouble." This kanji pictures just one of the many meanings of that phrase: it´s water that you get into (with creditors and the like) when your piggy bank is empty!
jp_example_words:
茶の湯(ちゃのゆ): tea ceremony
熱湯(ねっとう): boiling water
湯気(ゆげ): steam, vapour
湯飲み(ゆのみ): teacup
湯(ゆ): hot water
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If there's a tsunami it's easy to get hot water. Just stick your hand out the window as the tsunami goes by and poof! That water's HOT.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the boiling hot tsunami water as it comes for you. Psh, this will be easy.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As the hot water comes, you just lift up the bottom of the yurt (ゆ) you live in, and it comes flowing in. All of the cups, pots, and barrels you laid on your floor are now full of hot water.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You decided to live in a yurt because of the easy access it provides to hot water. They're so mobile!
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 汁 (суп), 日 (день), 勿 (конечно)
Ru_trainchinese:
tāng: (сущ) суп; кипяток; горячие источники
tāng: (сущ) Тан (фамилия)
shāng: (графема) (о воде) текущий
Kanshudo_mnemonic: glorious (昜) water (氵) is hot water
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Piglet meat in water?  Well that's called a delicious soup if you ask me!
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze text starts with " water ", "昜" sound, the original meaning is hot water. "Said Wen": "Soup, hot water. From the water, the sound."

Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people and places. Such as Master Tang Fu Ding: "Master Tang Fu worships the chief judge." The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were pretended to be " Tang ", and the bamboo slips of Guodian "The Way of Tang Yu" slip 1: "The Tao of Tang and Wu, broadcast but not spread." "Tang Wu" means Tang Yu, referring to the Tao of Yao and Shun. "Historical Records. "The Book of Five Emperors": "Emperor Yao is Tao Tang, and Emperor Shun is in doubt."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " water ", "昜" sound, the original meaning is hot water.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「水」，「昜」聲，本義是熱水。《說文》：「湯，熱水也。从水，昜聲。」

　　金文用為人名及地名。如師湯父鼎：「師湯父拜稽首」。戰國竹簡通假作「唐」，郭店竹簡〈唐虞之道〉簡1：「湯吳之道，播而不傳。」「湯吳」即唐虞，指堯舜之道。《史記．五帝本紀》：「帝堯為陶唐，帝舜為有虞。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「水」，「昜」聲，本義是熱水。

Chinese Definition:

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 昜 [ yáng ] bright, glorious; to expand, to open up
①熱水：湯雪。赴湯蹈火。揚湯止沸。
②煮東西的汁液：米湯。蔘湯。
③烹調後汁特別多的食物：雞湯。菜湯。清湯。
④專指溫泉(現多用於地名)：湯泉(溫泉)。湯山(在中國北京市)。
⑤中藥的劑型：湯劑。湯藥。
⑥姓氏。

金文從「 水 」，「 昜 」聲，本義是熱水。《說文》：「湯，熱水也。从水，昜聲。」 金文用為人名及地名。如師湯父鼎：「師湯父拜稽首」。戰國竹簡通假作「 唐 」，郭店竹簡〈唐虞之道〉簡1：「湯吳之道，播而不傳。」「湯吳」即唐虞，指堯舜之道。《史記．五帝本紀》：「帝堯為陶唐，帝舜為有虞。」
Bronze text starts with " water", " 昜" sound, the original meaning is hot water. "Said Wen": "Soup, hot water. From the water, the sound." Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people and places. Such as Master Tang Fu Ding: "Master Tang Fu worships the chief judge." The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were pretended to be " Tang", and the bamboo slips of Guodian "The Way of Tang Yu" slip 1: "The Tao of Tang and Wu, broadcast but not spread." "Tang Wu" means Tang Yu, referring to the Tao of Yao and Shun. "Historical Records. "The Book of Five Emperors": "Emperor Yao is Tao Tang, and Emperor Shun is in doubt."

湯字的基本解释

湯
tāng

湯
shāng
均见“汤”。

湯字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tāng］
［《廣韻》吐郎切，平唐，透。］
“汤1”的繁体字。
(1)沸水；热水。
(2)温泉。
(3)指温泉浴池。
(4)带汁水的菜肴。
(5)指食物加水煮出的汁液。
(6)中药汤剂。
(7)汤池，护城河。
(8)商朝的开国之君。又称成汤、成唐、武汤、武王、天乙等。
(9)姓。
[②]［tàng］
［《廣韻》他浪切，去宕，透。］
“汤2”的繁体字。
(1)高温物体与皮肤接触而使之产生疼痛感。
(2)把肉、菜放进开水里稍微煮一下就取出来。
(3)泛指煮。
(4)用开水或热水浇、泡。
(5)用热物接触冷物使之变暖。
(6)冲撞；冒。
(7)搪，抵挡。
(8)触，碰。
(9)用同“淌”。
(10)用同“趟”。参见“湯2湯兒”。
(11)通“蕩”。行为放纵。
(12)通“蕩”。大。参见“湯2禹”。
(13)通“蕩”。荡涤。
[③]［shāng］
［《廣韻》式羊切，平陽，書。］
亦作“漡1”。“汤3”的繁体字

湯字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　湯； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页638第16
【唐韻】土郎切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】他郎切，?音鏜。【說文】熱水也。【楚辭·九歌】浴蘭湯兮沐芳。　又水名。【山海經】上申之山，湯水出焉。又【水經注】江水，東逕瞿巫灘，左則湯谿水註之，源出朐忍縣北。　又谷名。【張衡·南都賦】湯谷涌其後。　又州名。【韻會】廣南化外，唐置湯州，天寶時爲湯泉郡。　又縣名。【廣輿記】湯隂縣，屬彰德府。　又【書·虞書疏】除殘去虐曰湯。馬融又云：雲行雨施曰湯。又【風俗通·王霸篇】湯者，攘也，昌也。言其攘除不軌，天下熾盛。　又【廣韻】式羊切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】尸羊切，?音商。湯湯，流貌。一曰波動之狀。【詩·大雅】江漢湯湯。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?他浪切，音儻。熱水沃也。【禮·月令】如以熱湯。　又【集韻】余章切，音陽。與暘同。暘谷，日所出也。亦作陽。【淮南子·天文訓】日出于湯谷。　又【廣韻】他浪切，音盪。與蕩通。【詩·陳風】子之湯兮。【傳】湯，蕩也。【箋】言游蕩無不爲也。　又與盪同。【前漢·天文志】四星若合，是

金文小篆楷体

暂无。

soup
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tāng］
["Guangyun" Turang cut, Ping Tang, through. ]
Traditional characters for "汤1".
(1) Boiling water; hot water.
(2) Hot springs.
(3) Refers to hot spring baths.
(4) Dishes with juice.
(5) Refers to the juice made by adding water to food.
(6) Chinese medicine decoction.
(7) Tangchi, the moat.
(8) The founding king of the Shang Dynasty. Also known as Chengtang, Chengtang, Wutang, Wuwang, Tianyi and so on.
(9) Last name.
[②]［tàng］
["Guangyun" He cuts, goes down, and sees through. ]
Traditional characters for "汤2".
(1) The hot object comes into contact with the skin and causes pain.
(2) Put the meat and vegetables in boiling water and cook them for a while before taking them out.
(3) Generally refers to boiled.
(4) Pour or soak with boiling water or hot water.
(5) Use a hot object to contact a cold object to warm it.
(6) Crash; risk.
(7) Prevarication, resistance.
(8) Touch, touch.
(9) Use the same as "drip".
(10) Use the same "trip". See "Soup 2 Soup".
(11) Through "swing". Indulge in behavior.
(12) Through "dang". Big. See "Tang 2 Yu".
(13) Through "dang". clean up.
[③]［shāng］
["Guangyun" style sheep cut, Pingyang, book. ]
Also known as "漡1". Traditional characters for "汤3"
soup
